page.title: 06EVENTS AT UPPER FROYLE
page.content:
In 1977 the Queen celebrated her Silver Jubilee and the village celebrated with a special day , ending with a bonfire and fireworks. Many of the village buildings were decorated with red, white and blue flags and banners and our school gave a special performance of songs and stories at the College called{"Jubilee 77".
In 1983 a{"Summer Occasion"}was held in Froyle{to raise money for repairs {to the church.} This lasted two days, the church was decorated for a flower festival, gardens were open, children's events were arranged and there was maypole dancing. Lunches were served in a marquee and teas were served at the school and local people exhibited their pictures and handicrafts.
